OrderingPartyRelationId.description: Identification of the party that issued the order to receive stock.

Id.description:
The identification that the ordering party uses for the order.

In some cases, an id is specified that Modexpress has
assigned itself, namely when it involves:

- a registered order for which the ordering party has not
specified an id that Modexpress can use as a unique id

- a blind receipt

- an automatically created return order (based on an
executed shipment)

Type.description:
Designation of the order type.

The XDOCKLOT orders are reported as PURCHASE.

Subtype.description:
A subdivision of the order type.

In case of an automatically created return order the subtype
will be 'AUTOMATISCH'.

Reference.description:
Reference for the order used by the ordering party.
In the case of an automatically created return order, this
refers to the shipment (SHP) for which the return order was created.
The reference is to the Order.Id (SHP 3-1-01). However, this is only
possible when the format of the Order.Id is a maximum of A20.

SenderExternalId.description:
Identification of the party that delivers the goods for the order.
The relevant party is not known to Modexpress by the relevant Id.

Not applicable in case of RETURN.

Date.description:
Date that the ordering party uses for the order.

Not applicable in case of RETURN.

ArrivalDateTime.description:
The delivery date/time at Modexpress of the shipment expected by the
supplier.

Not applicable in case of RETURN.

CompletionDateTime.description:
Date – where relevant, with the time – when the order was reported
ready/executed.

ProcessingStatus.description:
Indication of the status of the order: differs from RCP-Exec since it's a real-time status

- N - New, not yet started
- P - In progress, receipt has started
- C - Closed, receipt has been closed

Id.description:
The identification that the ordering party uses for the
order line. This is therefore the reference to the line
submitted in the RCP message.

If lines (SKUs) have been added in the
operation, no Id can be indicated because there is no
submitted line.

QuantityExpected.description:
The expected number of items in the order to receive goods.
This number is only indicated if the receipt was based on an
order submitted by the ordering party.

QuantityReceived.description:
The number of items of the article actually received
(regardless of stock type).

Reference.description:
The reference that the ordering party uses for the order
line and that the ordering party can use to recognise the
line.

ReturnReason.description: The reason (code) for the return of goods.

Id.description:
The identification that the owner uses for the received
SKU. This is usually a logical Id. Many owners use the
combination of STYLE+COLOUR+SIZE as a logical Id.

LotNumber.description: The lot/batch number of the received SKU.

Code.description:
A code used to recognise/identify the received article.
This is usually a code that is also affixed to the
article as a barcode.

RelationId.description:
Identification of the party that is the owner of the
received article.

RelationType.description:
Indication whether the Relation_Id is an internal or
external id.

- internal id: the id assigned
and used by Modexpress

- external id: the id assigned
and used by the ordering party.

StockType.description:
Designation of the type of stock that was
received. Using the stock type, it is possible to
differentiate according to different types of
stock that must be maintained separately for an
article (both in the operation and
administratively).



The standaard stock
types are (other types are possible):

- RGL - regular or
A-choice stock (received in pickarea)

- RGLRJC - regular
reject or B-choice stock

- INN - regular or
A-choice stock (received in inbound area)

- INNRJC - regular
reject or B-choice stock (received in inbound
area)

- INR - regular or
A-choice stock (received in return inbound area)

- INRRJC - regular
reject or B-choice stock (received in return
inbound area)



In the RCP-exec file
the area of the first receipt is mentioned. The
stock movements from an inbound area to a pick
area are separate transactions. These transaction
are mentioned via the STM interface (a minus on
INN stock and a plus on RGL stock). If the
received stock in the RCP-exec interface is used
to add the stock in your ERP, the stocktypes INN
(inbound area new stock) and INR (inbound area
return stock) have te be seen as RGL stock. In
that case Modexpress can configure not to sent the
transactions for the movement of the stock from de
inbound area to the pick area via the STM
interface.
- RGL
- RGLRJC
- INN
- INNRJC
- INR
- INRRJC
Other types assigned
by Modexpress

QuantityReceived.description:
The number of items of the article that were
actually received for the stock type.
